title.value: G4SATBench: Benchmarking and Advancing SAT Solving with Graph Neural Networks
title.justification: The title is directly extracted from the paper.
title.quote: G4SATBench: Benchmarking and Advancing SAT Solving with Graph Neural Networks

extractions.description: The paper presents G4SATBench, a benchmark study that establishes a comprehensive evaluation framework for Graph Neural Network (GNN)-based SAT solvers. It curates a large and diverse set of SAT datasets, benchmarks various GNN models, and conducts empirical studies to provide insights into the performance and learning abilities of GNN-based SAT solvers compared to traditional ones.

type.justification: The paper includes empirical results and benchmarking analyses to evaluate different GNN-based SAT solvers.
type.quote: Our empirical results provide valuable insights into the performance of GNN-based SAT solvers and further suggest that existing GNN models can effectively learn a solving strategy akin to greedy local search but struggle to learn backtracking search in the latent space.

name.value: SAT Solving with Graph Neural Networks
name.justification: The paper's primary focus is on SAT Solving using Graph Neural Networks (GNNs).
name.quote: To address this crucial gap, we present G4SATBench, the first benchmark study that establishes a comprehensive evaluation framework for GNN-based SAT solvers.

name.justification: The study involves machine learning techniques to enhance SAT solving.
name.quote: However, despite the growing volume of literature in this field, there remains a notable absence of a unified dataset and a fair benchmark to evaluate and compare existing approaches.

name.justification: The paper performs empirical analysis of different solving algorithms using GNNs.
name.quote: We benchmark a broad range of GNN models across various prediction tasks, training objectives, and inference algorithms.

name.justification: G4SATBench is the primary model discussed and benchmarked in the paper.
name.quote: To systematically quantify the progress in this field and facilitate rapid, reproducible, and generalizable research, we propose G4SATBench, the first comprehensive benchmark study for SAT solving with GNNs.

is_contributed.justification: G4SATBench is introduced and used as a contribution in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: We propose G4SATBench, the first comprehensive benchmark study for SAT solving with GNNs.

is_executed.justification: The G4SATBench model is executed in the scope of this paper.
is_executed.quote: Each experiment is performed on a single RTX8000 GPU and 16 AMD EPYC 7502 CPU cores, and the total time cost is approximately 8,000 GPU hours.

is_compared.justification: The G4SATBench model is compared numerically to other models within the scope of this paper.
is_compared.quote: Our empirical results provide valuable insights into the performance of GNN-based SAT solvers.

referenced_paper_title.justification: G4SATBench is a new contribution in this paper.

name.justification: The SR dataset is described as part of the diverse SAT datasets in G4SATBench.
name.quote: Specifically, we utilize the SR generator in NeuroSAT (Selsam et al., 2019).

referenced_paper_title.value: Learning a SAT solver with single-bit supervision
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for SR is NeuroSAT (Selsam et al., 2019).

name.justification: The 3-SAT dataset is part of the benchmark datasets used in the evaluation.
name.quote: For random problems, we utilize the 3-SAT generator in CNFGen (Lauria et al., 2017) to produce random CNF formulas.

referenced_paper_title.value: CNFGen: A generator of crafted benchmarks
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for 3-SAT is CNFGen (Lauria et al., 2017).

name.justification: CA dataset is part of the datasets characterized for benchmark evaluation.
name.quote: For pseudo-industrial problems, we employ the Community Attachment (CA) model (Giráldez-Cru & Levy, 2015).

referenced_paper_title.value: A modularity-based random SAT instances generator
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for CA is (Giráldez-Cru & Levy, 2015).

name.justification: PS dataset is included in the benchmark suite used for evaluation.
name.quote: For pseudo-industrial problems, we employ the Popularity-Similarity (PS) model (Giráldez-Cru & Levy, 2017).

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for PS dataset is (Giráldez-Cru & Levy, 2017).

name.justification: k-Clique is included in the diverse benchmark datasets.
name.quote: For combinatorics, we resort to 3 synthetic generators in CNFGen (Lauria et al., 2017) to create SAT instances derived from the translation of k-Clique, k-Dominating Set, and k-Vertex Cover problems.

referenced_paper_title.justification: k-Clique does not seem to have a directly referenced paper.

name.justification: k-Domset dataset is part of the combinatorial problem datasets used in G4SATBench.
name.quote: For combinatorics, we resort to 3 synthetic generators in CNFGen (Lauria et al., 2017) to create SAT instances derived from the translation of k-Clique, k-Dominating Set, and k-Vertex Cover problems.

referenced_paper_title.justification: k-Domset does not have a directly referenced paper.

name.justification: k-Vercov is included as one of the combinatorial problem datasets.
name.quote: For combinatorics, we resort to 3 synthetic generators in CNFGen (Lauria et al., 2017) to create SAT instances derived from the translation of k-Clique, k-Dominating Set, and k-Vertex Cover problems.

referenced_paper_title.justification: k-Vercov does not have a directly referenced paper.

name.justification: PyTorch library is used for implementing the neural networks in the study.
name.quote: All neural networks in our study are implemented using PyTorch (Paszke et al., 2019) and PyTorch Geometric (Fey & Lenssen, 2019)

referenced_paper_title.value: PyTorch: An imperative style, high-performance deep learning library
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for PyTorch is (Paszke et al., 2019).

name.justification: PyTorch Geometric is used for graph representation learning in the study.
name.quote: All neural networks in our study are implemented using PyTorch (Paszke et al., 2019) and PyTorch Geometric (Fey & Lenssen, 2019)

referenced_paper_title.value: Fast graph representation learning with PyTorch Geometric
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for PyTorch Geometric is (Fey & Lenssen, 2019).
